Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel really close to the harbour!”
Reviews.Author: lwa3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after 2 weeks in America. Check in very pleasant and quick. Free wifi to use in hotel - very convenient. Very spacious room which included full kitchen, table area, sofa & nice bathroom. Again toiletries provided very good quality. & room very clean. Staff very friendly & helpful. Was told about complimentary breakfast which was a nice bonus as we weren't expecting this. Lots of choice to eat too & times for breakfast quite long too. Reception stored our bags upon check out which was free. There is a lovely lounge area which has computers - again free for hotel guests to use. The hotel is located conveniently close to the harbour & in walking distance to some lovely restaurants! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: 190trav
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean Residence Inn- good location a few blocks from Inner Harbor. Price, at least the weekdays I booked, was cheaper than msot surrounding properties in its class by $20 to $40 (e.g. Hampton). As a Plat, was upgraded to a 1-BR, although it appears the studio and 1-BR might be the same size with the difference being the separating door/wall in the 1-BR. Parking is somewhat pricy, valet only for $34; could probably park in one of the garages toward the harbor for less and walk back a block to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Evee63
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night. Room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was nice and warm. They had a good variety. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Christiana01
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our 2 pugs stayed here for 2 nights and it was awesome. Everyone was very friendly. The rooms were very nice and updated. They complied with our requests for a feather free room and a room on a higher level (we stayed on the 15th floor). We enjoyed every second. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelProNJ
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay. Nice spacious room with 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa. Breakfast in the morning was busy however they were prepared and everything flowed nicely. The only issue I had was when I came back to the hotel to get my car from valet and bags from the bellman. I know they were not direct hotel employees but they work for the hotel.........They stood around talking to the girl at the FD and each other while I had been standing by the door to have them help me. I had to approach them after 5 min. Bad last impression.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Stay in Inner Harbor, but shifty valets!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnie22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend as a getaway for my 40th birthday. Overall, the stay was fine. We had a room on the 10th floor facing the street, so there was noise from the city traffic. On our first night there, we witnessed an arrest on the street below from our room. The room itself was fine, lots of room and met our needs. The breakfast was wonderful and the staff there were so friendly. The front dest staff were nice as well. They even kept our luggage for us on our last day so we could explore a bit more. The one con that ruined the stay for us and we will NOT stay here again is: we discovered that at some point while our car was with the valets (this hotel only has valet parking at $32 a day!) one of them stole all the quarters out of my coin drawer in the car. It's not the money that bothers me the most but the dishonesty of handing my car over to strangers and having them steal from me! And we tipped there jerks, too! BE WARNED if you use their valet service. There is a parking garage right across the street from the hotel. You would be better off using that, I think.

Reviews.Title: “GETTING BETTER AND BETTER”
Reviews.Author: Christinaki
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Residence Inn with my family, whenever we need to visit the Johns Hopkins Hospital and we find the Residence Inn better and better every time. This time we stayed with my daughter for six nights and we felt we were in our home away from home. First of all they have renovated the hotel entirely, the people working there could not have been nicer (from the girls at the front desk, Irina, Betty and Deana, to all the lovely people at the breakfast room, offering the best warm breakfast, included in the price of the rooms. The rooms are very big with every small or big amenity (huge refrigerator, microwave oven, stove, dishwasher etc), plus lovely double beds, plasma TV, tea and coffee facilities and every detail, that makes your stay comfortable. The location of the hotel could not be better, a few steps from the METRO, within short walking distance from the inner harbor, shopping and restaurants. I am looking forward to returning, every time I leave!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel near the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAuntA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good - a good value for the money and very close to the inner harbor, Camden Yards etc. Room was nice, clean, and had comfortable beds. Security seemed good - front door was key access only after 10, and you needed a room key to operate the elevator. The free breakfast was a plus - the food was good and plentiful, and included eggs, waffles and biscuits and gravy. It was expensive to park there using their valet, but I think that is pretty par for the course in downtown Baltimore. At least it was unlimited in and out parking. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: mgt2010
Reviews.Content: I needed a place that accepted pets; I was attending a conference at a nearby hotel and could not arrange a house-sitter in time. Residence Inn always comes through. Staff are very friendly and especially nice to the dog. There is a pet fee. The room was really nice, with a separate bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in the Harbor area”
Reviews.Author: DNA-Scientist
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with my two kids and my wife. Rooms are larger than in most hotels I have been, the full size fridge, stove, microwave and dishwasher are wonderful when you are traveling with kids and want to stay on a budget. The staff in the lobby, breakfast area and valet parking were ALL very friendly and professional, everybody I saw was working hard and very efficiently. My sister and her family were in another room and we had dinner downstairs all 3 nights. They let us stay in the breakfast area and gave us wine glasses for our wine... they were very accommodating. Thumbs up for whomever provides customer service training to the staff at this hotel, everybody was excellent. Breakfast was way above average for a free breakfast, items were constantly being replenished, all good. The mattresses were VERY comfortable. Our car was ready waiting for us within 10 minutes of calling in. All this for $129+ tax in that location?? Thank you to the Residence Inn people for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cmaloney70
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th stay at this hotel and we love it!! We were in town for a cheerleading competition. Great location to the Harbor and the 1st Mariner arena! We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: trippinwiththekids
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient hotel. For a family with 3 children, a suite hotel is a necessity and the Residence Inn fits the bill. But, you are sacrificing for the extra space and free breakfast, This hotel is LOUD. I have stayed in many downtown hotels and you do expect some street noise. However, this is extreme. We were awken both nights of our stay when the bars closed at 2am. On the second night I was awoken by the overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke, cologne, and beer. Apprently the large group of young men across the hall took their party back to the hotel after closing time. The bed was a bit uncomfortable. The pull out couch took up the whole room. The staff was very freindly and helpful. The breakfast was reasonable. Not great, but good. Most importantly, it fed our 3 kids and was free. Be there before 8:30 to avoid the very long wait. You get what you pay for. This is a reasonably priced hotel in a very convenient location. You get convenience and function, not luxury, at a Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: skitchener
Reviews.Content: As we drew up we were met by the porters who helped us with our luggage and took the car to park it. We were only booked in for 1 night, with children but asked for an upgrade anyway. We were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a suite (we are Marriott members). The room was very spacious and comfortable with a well equipped kitchenette and flat screen TVs in both bedrooms and the lounge. The hotel is close to the harbour and it was just a short 5 minute walk to be in the centre of things. All staff were very polite, even when we had to get things out of the car (the porters collected the car and took it back when we had finished). On asking where to eat dinner we were advised and took the option of the restaurant that shuttled us to and fro - Mo's Italian diner - a wonderful meal! Next morning the breakfast was wonderful and a huge choice of food. The only slight problem was the dining room was over crowded, but we ate in the lounged area at the suggestion of the reception staff. A wonderful place highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, But ...”
Reviews.Author: cmbbtb
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very warm and friendly. Main "ding" is that housekeeping needs to be a bit more on par. We had a two bedroom suite, and only one roll of toilet paper. Meaning, one bathroom had no paper at all! They also did not have any spare blankets in the room, and it was quite cold the night we were there. The beds only had sheets and a thin blanket. The other party we were traveling with also had room issues with an improperly installed dishwasher.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for extended or short stays, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: run2sea
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 weeks and had an overall excellent experience. Location: Excellent. The hotel is 2 blocks from the bustling center of activity in the Inner Harbor (near the USS Constellation) and a block from the Charles Center Metro Subway stop (exit Calvert Street). There's a supermarket 3 blocks away (north) on Charles Street, a pharmacy half a block away, a convenience store across the street. Room: Very good. The 1 bedroom studio was very comfortable and clean with modern amenities including two LCD TVs and a kitchen with stove, full size refrigerator with ice maker, dishwasher and a full set of dishware for four, and pots/pans and covered storage containers. There is a small dining table with chairs for two. I cooked on most nights and cleaned up but found that housekeeping was very attentive, sometimes even running my few remaining dishes and my through the dishwasher for me. The workspace was adequate with a full table next to electrical outlets and the room had both wired and wireless connections (included in the room charge as usual for Residence Inn). Internet speed was a little slow averaging around 0.5 Mbps downstream. The bed was a little soft for my taste and wasn't the full luxurious bedding offered at the flagship Marriott hotels, but otherwise was comfortable. There was generous closet space and separate sink from the toilet and shower/bath. Bar/Restaurant: There is a small, pleasant bar/restaurant downstairs that offers specials on many nights of the week. I enjoyed a burger and sweet potato tots that were very good. Breakfast was offered (also included in room rate) in a separate downstairs area that sometimes became crowded at peak times. The selections were quite varied with scrambled eggs, a breakfast meat, some type of potatoes and another hot item (sometimes breakfast sandwiches, etc), a variety of yogurts, breads, and two DIY waffle makers. Apple, orange, and cranberry juice cocktail were all available. There was ample coffee in the breakfast area as well as coffee and hot water available 24 hours near the elevators. Awesome! Staff at the restaurants were very friendly and welcoming. Other amenities: Laundry room offered an ample number of modern front load washers and powerful dryers (able to dry two average sized wash loads in one machine on a single cycle). Quarters and detergent are available at the front desk for purchase. The exercise room was small but available 24 hours and had modern treadmills with individual TVs and a small selection of dumb bell free weights. Business center/library offers free laser printing. Safety: The hotel felt very safe and there were usually two door men present at the main entrance at all hours. The area immediately around the hotel also seemed fairly safe. Overall, this is a very good hotel in an excellent location. I will stay here again for both business and pleasure and would gladly bring my family.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore trip 1/13/12”
Reviews.Author: cardimages
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, 4 rooms, trade show week at Baltimore convention center. Hotel is in great shape, staff is friendly and helpful. It's really nice having a bar/restaurant in this hotel. Rooms are large and comfortable. Excellent security (needed in downtown Baltimore). Good cab service. Nice fitness room. Only one minor issue. The shampoo/conditioner that is normally replaced daily in all Marriott properties was overlooked. I had to make one small shampoo container last five days... this is the second year in a row my company has stayed at this hotel in early January. We will again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, nice place, close to all”
Reviews.Author: emstraveler349
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel, 10th time in Baltimore, so I have stayed at others in the area. It doesnt have all the bells and whistles as some of the nicer places but it was great. Nice room, (ran out of toilet paper-no spare within), nice service at front desk, good breakfast (included with stay) and helpful service. Secure as well at night with key entry into the lobby area and elevators after a certain time, so that was nice. Parking garag across the street. Had to bring bags uo ourselves, a little surprised, but overall a good stay and would stay again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is very nice. I've stayed there three times and the staff has always been incredibly helpful and friendly. The last time we stayed there, there was a convention of high school kids staying on the floor we had planned on staying on and the staff moved us to a much larger, two bedroom suite upstairs. I also love that all the rooms have a kitchen and sitting area separate from the bedrooms. It's nice to have someplace to relax in a hotel room and to know that you don't have to go out to eat for every meal. In addition,the gym there is very well equipped. The only complaint I have is that the one time I had to use the laundry room there, you had to use coins and it was a huge pain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Far from Main City”
Reviews.Author: rahuldevmehta
Reviews.Content: Hi, Good basic 3-star hotel with excellent interiors, recommended more from a business conference perspective. Room space was very good with kichenette, small lounge area with sofas, bed, dresser and washroom. No porter or in-house F&B. You have to order food from outside - the reception has menus from neighbouring restaurants. Would recommend that you carry your own microwavable food and drinks. Decent conferencing facility for 15-20 people. Hotel is located in a quiet area, with not too many partying options around.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location - Helpful friendly staff - very clean - nice in house pub - all suite hotel - extremely comfortable Cons: Parking is problematic - A little too much street noise (sirens) - sleep timers on the TV's were inoperative Overall a great experience on this visit. The front staff recommended a very good seafood restaurant in the"Little Italy" that actually had a free shuttle (3 minute ride). The free breakfast was one of the better ones that I have had at Residence Inn properties and the dining room staff was very attentive to both guests and availability of food and beverage. When I say that parking was problematic, I was referring to the fact that there was only valet parking available. I prefer to park my own car so that I can have it available immediately whenever I want it. That being said, other reviewers have indicated that the valet response is very timely. In addition to having a fine pub/bar in the hotel, right next door there is the Water Street Pub which offers a full menu of pub fare and more. They also have a have decent selection of beer on tap including Guinness and Yuengling. The evening manager's hors d'oeuvres get together was well attended and the food was reasonably tasty. I would definitely use this hotel again as a base for business activities when visiting the Baltimore area. Business Center is 3 or 4 computers with printers in a really nice room right off the entrance of the hotel. No privacy in the business center and no business support activities available. Entire hotel offers high speed Wi-Fi which worked exceptionally well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mibar4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I got an awesome deal on a room. Our room was $99. It was on the top floor and had a separate bedroom/living area. I paid for the kind studio but ended up with the one bedroom. I'm not complaining though it was great. Valet was great got us a taxi and our car right away any time we needed it. breakfast was hectic like other reviewers have said but they had a lot of great options. The location was also perfect it took us 10 minutes to walk to inner harbor if that. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and probably will every time I go to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WineJunkie87
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Residence Inn was great. The room was clean and spacious. We only stayed two nights but were thrilled to have a full size fridge with an ice maker. The staff was polite and helpful, breakfast was good and location was great. The only drawback was the amount of homeless in the neighborhood and that is something the hotel can't control. Would recomment to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneGraham
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, the room was excellent, the staff were cheerful, friendly, helpful and informative, the rates were very good value, the room was quiet save for the endless fire trucks throughout the night. It was handy to all of the delightds of Inner Harbour, Federal Hill, the light rail, the Water Taxi and with a bit of exercise Fells Point, Little Italy and Harbour East. The big disappointment for us was the included breakfast. It did appeal to those who wanted bulk, sweet stodge. We ended up bringing our breakfasts in and having them in our room or, on occasions, eating out. If there was any fresh fruit it had disappeared soon after breakfast was served. The bread and pastries were stale. A smaller downside was how the communal areas were taken over by loud, aggressive attendees at a couple of sales conventions held there. We were not forewarned that the laundry required a mountain of quarters and ate up more than the dials indicated.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but don't go to the bar...”
Reviews.Author: aksweetie82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and in a great location, but after dark I was warned by lots of people not to go outside Because of the homeless problem which was a little frustrating. My friend and I had also decided to get a beer at the lobby bar before we went out for dinner. We noticed that the bartender was not really keeping everything clean. A little while later we both felt ill and had to cut our night short. Otherwise I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short of long term visit.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was nice when i checked in, got home to find bed bugs from the hotel. Terrible customer service when contacting the staff, I believe the person I was trying to talk to was Deena Goode was completely unprofessional as well as rude. Should look to stay at the numerous hotels across the street rather then this attempt at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst!”
Reviews.Author: Maryland21
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel. Please don't stay here. The staff is rude. The late night manager is rude. Find somewhere else to stay if you are crashing in Baltimore for the night

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mamacat58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our family have been going to Baltimore, Md for 11 yrs now. My daughter went to Loyola and eventually stayed and works in Baltimore. We have stayed in many Hotels and The Residence Inn has far exceeded all of them, from 3 star to 5 star..I know I read one of the reviews where the poster says they never told her and her husband about the parking garage across the street for $9 instead of the hotels valet parking at $32 a day...They fixed that problem, ( probably due to that poster) When we arrived they told us about the garage across the street or their valet parking. And the price difference.We chose theirs... Check in was simple and easy... Walked into the room, it was huge, with a small kitchen, stove, dishwasher, reg. size frig, dishes, pots, pans, etc.... desk for work , table to eat, king size bed, sofa bed couch... Every immenity you could want ... Clean, Clean and Clean.Bed was comfortable, pillows too.... Then a hotel staffer calls and asks if everything went ok and if we were satisfiied,, Yes, of course we were... The location was 2 min. to the harbor, Dunkin Donuts outside the door to the right... Water st. wear there were cafes and jazz lounges aroung the corner... We went to Supranos on Water St. for a night cap and heard a great Jazz band before we went up for the night...food looked good, we had dessert and that was good... The hotel had a guests dog behind the front desk counter, so cute, because he howls and gets lonely, so the desk clerk, said it was a win win situation for both guest and hotel...We didnt take out pets there, but definetly will next time... A one time $100 fee for 2 dogs. They had a lobby restaurant with bar, a very comfortable sitting area with TV and about 3 or 4 computers and a printer. A free coffee station and what I loved because I had my mom who didnt want to join us for dinner, they had a little store with soup and microwavable foods. I thought that was great... I did inquire about more than a few night stays, since my daughter and her husband do live there and will eventually have children. they did say that there is a discount for long length stays... Everything and everyone at this hotel was perfect and all I could say is that I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone... It was also reasonably priced...Take my advice and book and you will not feel sorry at all.... Baltimore is Wonderful and I love it...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Michele M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for a girls weekend away. This hotel was great all around. The front desk was very friendly and the rooms were great. We loved having the kitchenette for keeping our drinks and snacks cold in the fridge. We enjoyed having the seating area so we didn't have to sit on the beds the whole time while we were having drinks and socializing. The hotel provides a fantastic hot breakfast buffet in the morning- one of the best I have ever seen at this class hotel. We ate dinner in the 17 Restaurant- the food was good, but service was rather slow. If you are in a hurry, this may not be the place to eat. The only negative was the cost of valet parking- rather steep but parking is limited in the downtown area so we chose to utilize it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, well appointed hotel in the Inner Harbor/ downtown area of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: GOHART
Reviews.Content: Quick getaway close to home. Perfect from valet parking to checkout. Wonderful experience. Excellent location for walking to Inner Harbor, Camden Yards. Love Residence Inns and this one does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...great location”
Reviews.Author: telenurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to see the Red Sox. I had booked this long ago or so I thought. I inadvertently did not confirm it. They were able to find us a room for 3 nights. Originally we were put on the 3rd floor. Because this hotel is in the heart of the city on a busy street you hear all the noise on a lower floor. The 2nd night we moved to the 9th floor and it was much better. You could hear a pin drop inside the hotel...it is very quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and more then happy to give us directions daily. Free bus around town is right outside the door!! They also take pets here...which u never hear any noise from them. They had a Labordoodle staying with them. His owner would be at the hospital 12 hours a day. The front desk staff would take him behind the desk every day and take him out for walks. Breakfast is 630-930a daily and contains many hot items...scrambled eggs, oatmeal, sausage, waffles, etc. Inner harbor is within walking distance with many restaurant choices. We never even needed a cab the whole 4 days we were there! Camden Yard is an easy walk there or take the free bus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MsRe
Reviews.Content: Had a king studio which was very clean. We liked the layout of the room; didn't use the kitchen area but it's nice to know about for the next time we come. Breakfast was great, staff was helpful. Very convenient to Inner Harbor, 1st Mariner and Convention Center. Wasn't crazy about paying $32 for valet parking. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice on my part”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: Last week we spent one night in Baltimore prior to an early morning flight out. I chose this hotel over Henderson's Wharf in order to take advantage of a Marriott/Southwest promotion. What a mistake. We checked in very late in the afternoon in the very unimpressive lobby. I asked if there were any rooms with a nice view and was told "no" but that our room had one of the better views as it was a corner. We explained that we were using a Marriott gift card to pay for the stay and the clerk consulted with another employee with our gift card in hand. When we checked out the next morning, we were told there would be a hold on our American Express for the entire amount for 5 days. (We did call the manager later in the day and had the hold withdrawn, but how ridiculous when we were essentially paying cash.) The carpets in the hall are a very busy, ugly pattern. Our room was dark and dreary with brick walls and roofs the view from every window. The mattress was very hard and unyielding. The dining chairs are too low for the table height. We didn't experience breakfast as we had to leave by 6 in the morning. I wish I had stayed at Henderson's Wharf as the price would have been the same as the Residence Inn because parking is free there. And, I would have been in Fells Point with the restaurant choices I prefer. If you do want to be downtown and close to all the chain restaurants in the Inner Harbor, I would try the Renaissance or the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Inner Harbor spot”
Reviews.Author: 1Ray
Reviews.Content: 11Sep-16Sep 2011 Requested high floor but was on 5, was able to move to 14 on Tuesday. Very convenient to most of the inner harbor, water taxi, and convention center. Unlike other hotels co-workers were at, the internet was free. Parking (not used) was $32 as I recall, expensive, but then real estate is had to come by. They had two elevators, so wait time was minimal, even during the morning rush. The central air conditioning was very good, not too loud and kept the rooms at a constant temperature. Rooms were quiet, and isolated from inside noise although the sirens from outside penetrated the windows (double pane). First room was good, kitchen had what I needed to prepare a meal with food I brought (which was good after a three hour flight delay and being 8PM). Radio did not work but the alarm did. Second room had a bad odor like the rug was just chemically cleaned, left the windows open all day and that took care of the problem. The radio worked, but reception was poor. If you desire, you can put a sign out and housekeeping will not disturb your room, which is good if you have work materials spread out for easy access throughout the day. For folks who like to do radio ops, the two rooms I was in appeared to be RF shielded, very poor reception inside and unable to get out with 5 watt VHF/UHF. The building was recently renovated, but there were signs of age, a cracked sink, windows hard to use. I had a one bedroom suite which would have been OK for two, but iffy for three since the closet was small and the bathroom was off of the bedroom. Lighting was ok, but mostly floor lamps except for the kitchen and bathroom areas. In the first room I had to clean the kitchen counter. Staff was friendly and helpful, but the desk was undermanned for a hotel this size. There were several computers in the small business "center" that allowed you to print out thumbdrives or to access the internet to be able to print items on a laserjet. When I saw Housekeeping in the hall they wanted to service the room even though I was good with it the way it was, but they were very nice and helpful. Breakfast was a bit above average, with the standard scrambled eggs, a meat, and a potato, some fresh fruit, yogurts, juices, hot and cold cereals, etc. and a special item like biscuit or muffin sandwich, eggs Florentine, or french toast for my stay. Staff was very helpful if you asked for something not out, one of the better breakfast staffing I have seen in a while. Talking to co-workers in two other hotels, this was the best choice even if I did have to walk an extra two to three blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended! Great location and comfortable accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: bklynKat
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn is located in close proximity (easy walking distance) to the Baltimore Convention Center, Camden Yards, Inner Harbor, and much more. The rooms are a nice size, very clean, and comfortably furnished. Ours included a sofa, bed, and desk along with some hassocks that could be used as seats as well. We had our cat with us, and the staff was wonderful about welcoming her and providing us a sign for the door so that the room was not entered without us being there. Breakfast was good, although the breakfast room got very crowded, and when we were leaving breakfast, there was a line to get in! The breakfast room was well attended by the staff, and they kept the guests moving, and kept the space as clean as possible. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Overall a great stay, and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RustySkullz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I took a training Class at this hotel. I was so impressed with the hotel. Breakfast was great, and the rooms were spacious and so clean. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: lasalle2
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean rooms and staff are so accommodating. If we go back to Baltimore this is where we will stay. Free breakfast is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful Residence Inn I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Elitefreak
Reviews.Content: After my last Residence Inn stay (a dreary, dated, grungy experience at their LAX/Manhattan Beach, CA property), I can now claim that I have gone from worst to first in terms of the quality of the chain. The Baltimore property is amazing. Only two blocks from the Inner Harbor. Efficient curbside service to unload our stuff and have the car valet parked ($32 a day but this is a city so no surprise). Modern efficient lobby. Our room was absolutely spectacular. Our room actually had a view of the masts of the USS Constellation between two of the city buildings, but the view is otherwise NOT an Inner Harbor view (at least from the 9th floor). The design was stunning, from the carpet to the wall coverings to the furniture. My 16 year old daughter, a fan of shows like Design Star, was especially fond of the upholstered chair and its very cool fabric. Bathroom and kitchen are similarly well appointed, with granite all around. Bag of microwave popcorn waiting for you when you arrive. And as for the breakfast buffet, where did you ever see potato pancakes at a complimentary hotel breakfast? They were delicious, as was the rest of the breakfast spread. Even the coffee was decent. This is an amazing Marriott property, and I will definitely return the next time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: vatraveler050
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days for mini vacation. Great access to harbor, little italy, restaurants. Stayed in suite with friends for 200per night. Room was great. Parking 32 per night. Slow service for breakfast. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: dsb2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good location for visiting both the Inner Harbor and going to ballgames at Camden Yards, both of which are 10-15 minutes walk away. Their is also a Charm City bus stop right in front of the hotel. This is a free bus which circulates throughout the city on several different routes and is a great way to get to neighborhoods like Mount Vernon. As for the hotel itself, we got a good rate for our visit, and were upgraded from a studio suite to a suite with two rooms. It's nice having a full-size refrigerator, complete set of dishes, microwave, etc., in your room. Since the hotel is downtown, it can get a little noisy at night with sirens, etc. The air conditioning wasn't working properly in the first room we were given. Several maintenance men looked at it and assured us it was working properly and would cool our room off, but we were skeptical and asked to be switched to another room, which was much more comfortable. One of the reasons we stayed at this hotel was because of the free hot breakfast included with our room. However, both mornings we waited until 30 or minutes or so before breakfast was done being served and found the dining room to be quite crowded, with a line going out of the door and into the hallway on our second morning there. They were running out of staples like eggs, etc., although the staff was doing its best to replenish the items as quickly as possible. But it was a bit chaotic. My suggestion would be to get up earlier and get down to breakfast before it gets too crowded! While we did have a HD flat-screen TV in both of our rooms, only one remote control worked. We don't watch much TV anyway, so it wasn't a big deal, and I'm sure we could have called down to the front desk and gotten a new battery or remote, etc. The hotel does have free wireless, which is always a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: SportsMom_11
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is a good location and value if you are traveling as a family. We are a family of four with two large teen sons and the room size was fine. The bathroom was towards the small end. There is a side street close by that has a few quaint restaurants with outdoor seating which was a great find. The buffet brekfast while not great was adequate if you want to eat and get out quickly in the morning. Just don't arrive towards the end of the serving time or you will find few options still available. The service was good and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chrisnewyork
Reviews.Content: hotel is in walking distance of the harbor. Great for families with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Walkable to the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: conshy04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night with my family and found the property to be very nice. Was a bit concerned about the cost of parking ($32) but was happy to find out that the price included parking for the next day until 5pm which made the cost much more reasonable. The morning breakfest was nice and the staff couldn't have been better. Tip: There is a CVS almost right next door and some great pubs right below the hotel in the cobblestone street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: solei6
Reviews.Content: Spend a weekend with my family at this Hotel Great location, within walking distance of Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. Excellent breakfast included with a huge selection. The service was the best. From the doorman to the front desk. The rooms are extra big with a full kitchen including dishwasher, refrigerator and microwave. Great Hotel at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Tucker05
Reviews.Content: The Residence had one of the better rates of the Marriott hotels in the Inner Harbor area. We also noticed that it had some of the better reviews. The room was very nice it had 2 queen beds, nice size bathroom, and a kitchenette with a full size fridge. They accomodated all of my requests, and we had free hot and cold breakfast every morning. The people at the hotel went out of there way to help. The location is pretty good. It's not RIGHT on the harbor like some of the other places, but the walk is quick, safe, and VERY easy. We parked our car and didn't use it until we left. The valet parking is $32 per day which seemed a little high, but this way we didn't have to find a spot and lug all of our bags. I'm not sure what the rates are in downtown Baltimore, but after thinking about it the $32 was probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Trendy Residence Inn in a great location"”
Reviews.Author: iugirl83
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to Baltimore for business just for one night. Not familiar with the area, but spend lots of time in Residence Inns, so this is what we picked after looking at in on-line. We all know Residence Inns can definitely vary, but this one was top-notch! The decor was beautiful, contemporary style that fit the downtown Baltimore area. All stainless- steel appliances, with apple green accent colors. When we arrived the front desk was very busy, due to an Orioles game. (Stadium is within walking distance.) We had to wait for no less then 10 minutes, which didn't bother us at all. Due to or wait they upgraded our room to a double room, instead of a single room! The staff was excellent everyone! They offered resturant suggests and tips of things to do on our one night there. They all were so friendly, helpful, and seemed to enjoy their work. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to lots of downtown attractions, and want a nice place to lay their head at night! It is also pet friendly, with a hefty fee, however the hotel is so nice I feel like it's totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, responsive staff, but there were numerous issues”
Reviews.Author: Traveln_Momma
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to it's proximity to Baltimore's Inner Harbor, we wanted a kitchen/suite arrangement, and based on other reviewers on Tripadvisor. We stayed 3 nights. I am giving this hotel an average rating because there were some positives, but we had 5 significant problems that would keep me from recommending this hotel. I apologize in advance that this is so lengthy. Positives: Staff was friendly and welcoming. They were responsive to our concerns (see Negatives below). Our room was made up as requested on our reservation. The valet parking, although pricey, was offset by the reasonable price for the room and our vehicle always arrived quickly.Very busy breakfast areas, but the staff really hustled to keep items stocked. Plenty of typical "free breakfast" choices but each day something different was offered. Negatives: We have stayed at many Marriott Hotels and Residence Inns. This hotel is 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. We felt safe walking around during the day, but it was a little sketchy at night. Also, we had several issues during our stay: 1.) Room had an odor that we couldn't put our finger on. Old garlic? Bad chinese food? Previous guest's cooking or someone from another room? It lingered and wouldn't go away. Room was adequately clean. We talked to the front desk the following day & they showed us and offered us another room, but it also had some of the same odor & the hassle of moving everything just wasn't worth it. After 3 days in the hotel we surmised it was coming up the elevator shaft from the cooking area/restaurant downstairs because sometimes it seemed worse in the hallway. We just closed our door fast when we got to the room to limit the smell coming in. 2.) When we opened the extra bedding to make up the pull out sofa, the blanket was visibly soiled and unwashed (gross). We contacted the front desk who apologized profusely, offered us additional Marriott Reward points, and within minutes another blanket (new in package) was brought to our room. 3.) Child sleeping in pullout was cold, so we requested an additional blanket the next night. When we returned from our day of sightseeing, another "quilt" had been tossed on our bed. When child went to spread on their bed, they shouted "GROSS": again, this item was also visibly soiled and unwashed. We again called the front desk. They had another new blanket brought to the room right away and asked that we show the soiling to the housekeeping staff and that person would be showing it to the manager. Again, big apology & more Marriott points. 4.) Around 2:45 a.m. second night of our stay, kids heard a man in hall, outside our door, singing and talking to himself. Person then started banging on our door, trying to use a key to open our door, yelling. It was terrifying! I called the front desk and asked if there was security on staff & explained situation. Was told that it must be the same guest who had been drunk and singing in the lobby before getting on elevator (not very comforting to hear!). We requested that someone come up immediately to take care of situation. We barely slept the rest of the night. 5:) Next day, we returned from sight seeing around 2:00 p.m. and found our room open (swing latch was moved so room door wouldn't close and latch). We had gone back to the harbor that morning. Our older child stayed behind and had requested maintenance come to the room due to a plumbing issue and then left to meet the rest of the family at 12:30. Room was unmade and no housekeeping was near our room to give us impression they were working in room. Our child was certain they had closed door securely. My husband called to complain to hotel manager (really-we had hit our limit)!. Manager came to our room right away, We didn't find anything stolen. The hotel manager listened to our numerous issues during our stay and did work with us to compensate our family for all the turmoil. He also had security check the electronic lock and it was determined that a maintenance person who came to fix plumbing left door ajar/unlatched.

Reviews.Title: “Totally posh for the price.”
Reviews.Author: chrysslyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this last year during our annual excursion to Maryland Deathfest. We got a studio at the "long term stay" price for $199 a night. Considering the relative prices of other area hotels, what we got was just absolutely *amazing*. Gorgeous room, great kitchen facilities, state of the art entertainment center, just generally awesome. Totally worth the money even when you *aren't* cramming 6 people into the room. The staff were also fantastic. They were polite, on top of everything, and never batted an eye at the dozens of scuzzy metalheads we had trooping in and out at all hours. (Note: I realize this may be a negative for more refined folks also staying at the hotel, but I assure you we were not being rude or offensive in behavior, only potentially in appearance.) Oh, and bonus: I have multiple food allergies and the restaurant was actually able to accommodate my special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family!”
Reviews.Author: psmom03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband, 2 kids and my parents. I had tried to book a 2 bedroom suite but when I booked, that room was unvailable. I then booked 2 seperate rooms. Upon checking in, we were early, but they got us right in & somehow, the 2 bedroom suite I wanted was available. We took that even though that was less money than the 2 rooms I had originally paid for. When I mentioned that to the front desk, they offered me a $50 gift card which I took. The suite was very spacious, well decorated and very comfortable. We didn't spend much time in the room that night as we had tickets for a ball game. The suite had 2 full bathrooms which was a great plus! it also has a full kitchen that we didn't use but I thought was great for extended stays. One of the biggest perks of staying at this hotel was the morning breakfast that is included in your stay. They had just about everything you could think of, definintely something for everyone!! And more than enough!! Safety is a concern of mine, having 2 young children with me, it was nice knowing only guests with their room key could operate the elevators. I would highly recommend this hotel, it's in a great location - walking distance to just about everything, the hotel is very nice & clean. I would definintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wsflyer
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is within easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor. The rooms are quite spacious. The staff was helpful. What amazed me was the breakfast. I have stayed at many Residence Inns and similar hotels, but this breakfast had many, many choices and good quality. I was very pleased with the hotel. However, the parking was expensive, but that was disclosed upfront.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Jolinda77
Reviews.Content: Friendly smiles from every staff person we met! We were able to check in early. Within in one hour of getting in our room, we received a phone call from the front desk clerk who wanted to know if everything was as it should be. Clean! Close to the Inner Harbor. Quiet. The complimentary breakfast was a great buffet for the healthy eater in my family and for the two of us who went for the heartier eggs, pancakes, waffles, etc. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a great value in a great location. My compliments to the staff and those who have taught them how to be wonderful to their customers. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good location”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: We've been to Baltimore to U2 Concert and we took an extra day to explore the city. So, we made a reserach based on this criteria: location! And this typical Chain Hotel didn`t disapointed us. Two blocks from the harbour and mall. Few blocks away - walking distance - to the Orioeles Ballpark e Ravens Stadium (where the concert took place),this hotel has also a very helpful & kind staff and very large room (mini kitchen with all equipments inclued). Nothing to complain. See you soon, Baltimore. Fabio & Andrea - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Spacious Room and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: BobandBella
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the room was spacious, modern and comfortable for a family of four. The hotel is only a few blocks to the Inner Harbor which made it convenient for touring. Overall and nice place for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stadiaguy
Reviews.Content: Central location to where we needed to be, very walkable to Inner Harbor. Very friendly front desk staff, allowed me to check in a couple of hours early due to travel changes. Workout space was modern and well apppointed, a tad on the cozy side, but that is overshadowed by the fact there is a tv remote on each piece of equipment, nice touch. Room was clean and comortable, if you are a light sleeper, you may want to ask about a high number floor as there is a good amount of city noise, but it was a Saturday night. Breakfast with the room, I did not try it but it was stocked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Audra631
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing our stay at this hotel and have really enjoyed our 4 day trip to Baltimore. The hotel is what's best about the Residence Inn chain from Marriott: well designed hotels, competent and helpful staff, in great locations for travelers. This hotel is in the Inner Harbor district of Baltimore with an easy 3 block walk to the Inner Harbor and its many attractions. It is also right on/near two routes of the Charm City Circulator, the free bus service that is a real gift for tourists. Across the street from the hotel is a 7-Eleven, a block away is a CVS with a good selection of food and drinks, and there are several restaurants in the area including on at the hotel. The hotel is a high rise with15 floors with an exercise room and guest laundry on the 2nd floor and a business center on the 1st floor. Although the hotel serves the usual buffet breakfast in the 1st floor Hearth Room, we tend to be cereal eaters so our trips usually include a trip to the local convenience store for cereal, milk, bottled water, and other stuff. With the convenient stores in the area that was a breeze. The first floor also featured an Express Market which sold snacks and drinks. The rooms were compactly designed as is often the case in an urban hotel. Our 1 bedroom suite included a bedroom with an in suite bathroom and sliding door closet with ample hangers, an iron and ironing board, a queen size bed, 2 nightstands, a dresser holding a 37" LCD LG TV, and a clock radio. The room was snug, but comfortable, with plenty of pillows and an extra blanket if needed. The bed was comfortable and the pillows actually had some fluff in them. If we had one minor complaint it would be that the lighting in the bathroom where the toilet and shower were was minimal, but that is a complaint we have had in many hotels so we've gotten used to it. The shower itself featured a very nice adjustable showerhead with plenty of water pressure. Again everything was clean and in good condition. The main room consisted of a living room and kitchenette. The room's kitchenette featuring a full size rerigerator, microwave, two burner stove, sink and dishwasher plus a decent selection of plates, glasses, silverware, pans, etc practically begged to be used. Everything was in great condition and the helpful cleaning staff nicely loaded our used dishes and ran the diswasher each day. The living room included a full size couch and arm chair for comfortable lounging in front of another 37" LG LCT TV, coffee table/ottomans, an end table, a computer disk, and tucked into the corner a table with 2 chairs for eating or reading. It was a very functional layout with plenty of room for two people to spread their stuff around and it was all done very stylishly. There was some street noise as is to be expected in an urban hotel, but less than I've experience in many places. There was no noise from other rooms or the elevator which was 10 feet from the door to our suite. Transportation in the area was a breeze with the two Charm City Circulator routes plus local bus service and the light rail station just a few blocks a way. We took the light rail from BWI to the area of the hotel and then it was a few blocks walk to the hotel itself. Going back to BWI we opted to use SuperShuttle for convenience. It was a mere $13 fare to BWI from the hotel plus tip.and fuel surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Prlgirl
Reviews.Content: I did not want to leave the residence inn. My family and I went to Baltimore to catch a game and I did a lot of research and decided on Residence Inn after checking out TripAdvisor. From the moment we checked in we were impressed. The valet was pleasant and remembered our family name every time we took the car out. The room was huge with a kitchen, flat screen and separate living area. The front desk called after we checked in to make sure everything was ok. the continental breakfast was delicious-hot and cold items that were restocked. The hotel itself is in a great location-close to lots of great restaurants and Camden Yards. Overall a fantastic stay with great staff and a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I picked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cstephens86
Reviews.Content: So...I am about to go to law school and am deciding between South Carolina and U of Maryland in downtown Baltimore. We are from South Carolina so my fiancé and I are used to hearing the horror stories of crime in Baltimore. So we figured there's no way we can move there without at least staying a weekend and checking things out. We picked this hotel because it is close to the harbor and hoped that would be safe for walking around. I originally wanted to rent a car to get around but was worried it would be a waste of money if we didn't use it. I called the hotel and they were insistent that I would not need a car to get around, that the area was perfectly safe to walk. Just let me say I am so glad that I listened to them! We were out and about from early in the morning on a Saturday until late afternoon on Monday and had an amazing time. The hotel was great. The room was set up the way a small apartment would be set up, so it felt a little more home-like than a standard hotel room. The hotel was extremely clean and the front desk was one of the more helpful I have encountered. By comparison when I stay in New Orleans I can barely get the front desks to get new towels, here the front desk was helpful with all my questions about the area, calling a cab to get back to the airport, etc etc. At night I woke up a few times because of street noise but I completely expected that to be the case in the city so it was no big deal. Also, the breakfast was great with eggs, biscuits, bagels, etc. The best part for the hotel was that I went to an Orioles game and bought a t-shirt and when I left in the cab I forgot my shirt in the lobby area. When I got to the airport I called and asked if they would hold it until I sent them a labeled box to send it back to me. I half expected it to get lost or the person who received the box to not know what it was for or something like that. But sure enough about a week or so after I mailed the box the shirt came back to me in the mail. I was very impressed that they bothered to take the time to do something like that! This location was perfect to walk around the harbor, to Federal Hill, and U of Maryland-Baltimore/ Camden Yards. We even walked to Mt Vernon and Fells Point, which we thought would be a little sketchy in between the hotel and those areas but it wasn't bad like we thought. The worst I could say was that there were a few panhandlers around the hotel but they weren't especially aggressive or anything to worry about. I would definitely recommend this hotel with its great staff and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Gem”
Reviews.Author: BabeRuth0367
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while I was at a conference at a nearby hotel. Breakfast is included and we had a great experience. The staff is very service oriented. There seem to be a number of roomy one-bedroom suites in this Res Inn. I highly recommend this well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation In Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveRuss
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at this hotel twice in April, for one night prior to a cruise and three nights when we got back. Lets get to it then, all the staff we met were excellent from the greeting as we got out of the cab to the time we walked out the front door. Nothing was ever too much trouble. It was very busy when we were there, lots of children and it was a holiday. That meant that breakfast was rather more hectic but to be expected. All the usual for hot and cold was available and included in the price of the suite. Yes these are suites, so you get a small kitchen with all appliances, lounge, bedroom and bathroom. Very good size indeed. I always moan on here about wi-fi access but cannot about the residence inn as it's free and was of a good speed too. The location was excellent, a short stroll (less then 5 minutes) and your at the waterfront of the inner harbour where most Baltimore attractions and shops are. It's also a short stroll to the Camden Yards and Baltimore's baseball team the Orioles. Well worth a night out. If you want to go to Lexington Market area (The area is a dump really) or Penn Station for a train to Washington DC then take the free bus which picks up from the side of the residence inn. Excellent service for getting around. If you want to go any further grab a cab, they are cheap and friendly. All in all no option but to give the Residence Inn by Marriott five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well run, great location”
Reviews.Author: tobynh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed for more extended stays with complete kitchen, large comfortable rooms. The staff was helpful and courteous and had no problems with an early checkin that I had called when making the reservation. The room well appointed, clean, quiet and along with the complimentary coffee, even had microwave popcorn in the welcome basket. Complimentary breakfast was better than most with hot items as well as the usual continental stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, convenient, affortable. A keeper...”
Reviews.Author: SunSonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 1 night on the way to Washington DC. It was very clean, confortable, nice sleeping conditions. the studio room had a full kitchen and a separate bedroom with confortable king bed. The room was modern and nicely decorated. No complaints! Would stay there again. There was complementary breakfast which was very nice and with lots of variety including self made waffles, yogurt, cereal, pastries, coffee etc but there was a bit of a crowd. Location is perfect for the inner harbor and candem yards. valet parking was a bit slow but very nice to have. Try the chocolate mouse cheesecake at the nearby Cheesecake factory.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip more relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: bvukovich
Reviews.Content: This hotel was JUST GREAT. We are a family of 5 - 2 parents and triplet 2 YO boys. we had a 2 BR room at the Residence Inn for 8 nights and wer traveling from overseas. The hotel helped us arrange transport from DUlles ( Apollo transport - so helpful - they bought 2 more car seats so that we didn't have to bring ours from overseas!), were friendly and helpful in helping us find necessities around the area (grovery, pharmacy, etc). our first morning (after a 14 hour flight) we had a pleasant surprise of a WONDERFUL hot breakfast that was included with the room. eggs, a vat of oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt parfaits, potato pancakes, you name it. Breakfast had staples everyday, but they changed it up a bit. we were so thankful to see that our kids would have a decent breakfast every morning and it would help us save on our food bill for the week. it is a SHORT walk form the harbor area, the convention center (we were there for a conference and then a few days with family), etc. it's right off of several FREE bus lines, and a decent grocery store is within 10 mins walk, as is a walk in clinic if necessary. wiresless and ethernet is included, and they have an area where you can print if necessary. the rooms are nicely appointed and it appears to be new or newly renovated. THey even took us to their basement when our triple stroller began to get a flat tire! it was no problem getting 3 cribs and everyone was helpful and pleasant throughout our entire stay, from desk staff, to the breakfast staff, to the valet/doormen - literally EVERYONE. one thign to know, it IS in the city and it does overlook busy streets. so you get some sirens. luckily we were all so tired it never bothered us, but if you are looking for a super quiet place, this is not the place to be. with that said, it was never LOUD either - you could just hear them going by. i mean, you are in a city. at least they are responding, right?

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for.. Location, Price, & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ThePowellFamily
Reviews.Content: Two of my close girlfriends and I stayed at Residence Inn by Marriott in Downtown/Inner Harbor, and had a spectacular time. We arrived early, and as soon we pulled up the Valet Parking guys were opening our doors, and greating us. They took our bags and loaded them, as well as escorted us into the lobby for check in. We were able to check in early with no issues, and the ladies at the front desk were very friendly. Our room was large, with a stocked kitchen. The room /kitchen/bathroom were spotless. Although we didn't have a view (faced another building), it didn't matter to us..We were content with the amount of space we had to spread out, unwind and catch up with one another. The location was great. We were able to walk to the inner harbor, but due to it being late..we grabbed a cab and explored downtown. The bell hops were great at giving suggestions, and directions to where we needed to go. The breakfast provided in the morning was by far the BEST breakfast at a hotel we've ever had. It was packed, which was to be expected..but worth waiting in line for. Check out was easy, and our car was brought back to us quickly. All of us agreed that we can't wait to come back to Residence Inn with our families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: One block away from the Renaissance for half the price. A cheap, clean and spacious Residence Inn suite without the big hotel services, although you can get room service from the bar downstairs. Free wifi and good standard of furnishings, TV in both the living area and bedroom. Staff were efficient and friendly. Good security with room key access to the elevators and front door locked after 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: buchanan913
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. They have valet parking, you pay for it, but they have it. There is a public garage next door that is probably cheaper for overnight parking. The hotel is in a great location; it is centrally located between the convention center and the inner harbor. The rooms are new and very nice. They have all the amenities you need. The rate was great for the weekend stay. The other hotels at the same rate and some even higher were not as nice. There was a complimentary breakfast. It was crowded, but they had the basics, eggs, biscuits and gravy, waffles, potatoes, pastries, breads and bagels, yogurt, fruit juices and coffee. It was good too. The elevator is secure as well. In order to go up to the upper floors you must have a room key or the elevator doesn’t work. It is a great security measure. Give it a try and you won’t be disappointment, we certainly were not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ccmckn
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and everything about it is excellent. I think it may be one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in and the staff is so friendly. The location is great with only a 2 block walk to the harbor. This will be our regular place to stay when we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: coldinerie1
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. It was in a great location, 2 blocks from the inner harbor! The room must have just been redone. It was updated and almost brand new. Great to have a full service kitchen in the room as well. We had a studio suite. Breakfast was good. Lots of choices and hot food. Yum! We would return to the hotel again. Great value and great room. Oh yea, could not get the public computers to print our pending cruise docs, so the hotel desk clerk went out of her way to help me, and ended up printing my documents for me, at no cost I might add! Thats going the extra mile for a guest!

Reviews.Title: “Freakishly Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Scott-fan
Reviews.Content: You would be wrong to stay anywhere else in Baltimore..This place is freshly renovate, rooms are huge, we had a King, nice sized sitting area, full sized kitchen, plasma TV, soooo close to Inner Harbor you could somersault to it! Nice hot fresh breakfast is included in the rate, and I am not talking bagels and donuts...Homefries, hash, eggs, yogurt, fruit, cereal, and more!!! As much as you want! Its very convenient to Inner Harbor, a short 2 block jaunt away..forget something? CVS is 1/2 block away...dunkin donuts, 7-11 and 3 nice quaint bars are there too! I am never staying anywhere else in Baltimore! The quality of the hotel and staff merit my return business always!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, attentive staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Dreamn18
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel one night, but wish it could have been more. The room was huge, decorated nicely and a good value. The valet parking worked out well and the valets were very nice even when I went in and out 3 times in one day. Breakfast had lots of options but no soy milk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Well Priced”
Reviews.Author: VMAK09
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed here while visiting the Inner Harbor area for the day. The hotel is very easy to find and very easy to pull up to from Light Street. We arrived early (around 11:30am) and were able to check-in to a ready room. The rooms are large just like the other Residence Inns. These have been updated to the new linens and have the nice LG LCD tvs. The best thing about the hotel was that the Inner Harbor was 2 blocks away and very very easy to get to the Inner Harbor. The only downside was that next day breakfast was served til 9:45am since it was technically a holiday (Columbus Day) so breakfast til 10am but no one was sure what time breakfast should've been open til. So at 9:30am the manager would bring food out and almost immediately behind him a lady would pick up the food and take it to the prep room. The tray would remain empty until someone would ask about it. All in all, the is a fantastic hotel to stay at to visit the Inner Harbor and all its attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchen was worth the price of the room”
Reviews.Author: ShanleighT
Reviews.Content: Needed a kitchen for sample preparation for a food competition. This was not more than a 5 minute walk to the conference center, the harbor and surrounding attractions. We had 3 bedrooms in one for a very good price. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone who prefers preparing their own food or enjoys extra room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: esu3sgt
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, pretty standard with the Residence Inn Brand. The parking was very expensice and the additional tax shot the bill up. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: Madigan5
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Great location. Staff super friendly and helpful. Wonderful pet friendly hotel in downtown Baltimore. Wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Rooms, Good service”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFairfax
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Residence Inn in downtown Baltimore in March 2010. Checkin was a breeze. Took about 2 mins. Valet parking was well coordinated. Valet took the keys and came back to checkin to get the room number Room were large. We got double beds. Kitchen had all the appliances Hotel is in nice location. About 5 mins walk from harbor. Nearby to attractions Safe place

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Comfortable, Adequate. Convenient to the Aquarium.”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler443
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a 2 bedroom suite. It was clean and roomy. Staff was very nice. The location is walking distance to the Inner Harbor which is largely unimpressive, except for the amazing Aquarium. If you need to be in the Inner Harbor it's fine but I realized after the fact that Baltimore has many other neighborhoods that would have been more fun to stay in. Evening snacks were a bit weak but free. Didn't try the free breakfast because the Dunkin' Donuts next door was too tempting.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room Near Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: jennifernycity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night for a wedding in Baltimore's Inner Harbor. We hadn't asked for early check-in, but when we arrived at noon, the folks at the front desk were very happy to accommodate us. Note: The hotel only has valet parking available. The room was spacious and very clean with a nice sitting area and flat-screen TV. Water pressure was solid. Bed was comfortable.The hotel offers free Internet, but not Wi-Fi. (They provided the necessary cable.) The hotel bar was lively (as many people were watching the World Cup) and the bartender was attentive. There was a Dunkin' Donuts and a McDonald's next to the hotel, as well as a 7-Eleven across the street. There is also a small market in the hotel lobby with basic snacks and drinks, which you can charge to your room. As with any hotel in this area, you should use common sense while walking around after dark. Cabs were easy to find. It was about $15 to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gmarkley
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is very helpfull and nice. The rooms are the avarage residence inn style layout a little out dated but not too bad. The beds are nice. Advice "Ask for a high floor." II found the Hotel to be busy and a little noisy and very Busy with local conventions going on. I would stay here again the proximity to the water front and price make it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam1022
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in the good downtown location......................

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: katherine524
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way down to Virginia from New Jersey. The hotel was very easy to drive to and we were able to pull right up to the entrance, even during rush hour traffic. We were met right away by the Valet who helped us with our luggage and made check-in very easy. The hotel is 2 blocks away from the waterfront and it was very nice to come back to a clean and comfortable hotel room after visiting the aquarium. The breakfast had so many choices and was wonderful to have upon waking up in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- very convenient”
Reviews.Author: gcsmom
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is steps from Inner Harbor and walking distance to Camden Yards. The rooms were clean and spacious and we even got upgraded to a bigger room when we arrived early and our room was not yet ready. The staff was so nice and friendly and very helpful with all our tourist questions. The complimentary breakfast in the morining was wonderful too as it was a real buffet- not just contintental, so we started our day with a full belly. The kitchenette in the room made it very easy to grab a quick lunch before heading out. Would DEFINITELT stay her again next time we visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Crooze
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a business trip. The property is in the middle of downtown, close to the office building I visited and within walking distance to the Inner Harbor. As a woman traveling alone, I did have to keep an eye on my entire surroundings whenever I walked in town. Just had to play it smart and not stay out too late as there are a lot of pan handlers both day and night. The hotel itself was always clean, the personnel always accommodating and professional, and the convenience of having a complimentary hot breakfast every morning was a plus. The kitchenette in my room was also quite convenient, and my room had a separate table for eating and another for working, which I did almost every evening. The wired internet connection worked great. At times, I could hear the sirens coming from the street below but it wasn't too bothersome since I was on the 11th floor. I would suggest staying on upper floor to avoid street noise. I also used the gym which was quite adequate with a couple of stairmasters, a few treadmills and bikes. All newer equipment which was offered a great workout. All in all, the Residence Inn in downtown Baltimore is a nice property for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “$100 Pet Fee, Valet Parking Only for $29/night - but they adjusted”
Reviews.Author: uagrad
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on Priceline.com ($131 after taxes and all). Then at the front desk I was told the pet fee was $100 non-refundable. And on top of that, the only hotel parking was valet at $29/night. So, basically my price doubled at check-in. I was kind, but expressed my frusteration. The manager overheard. After getting my car unpacked, she called me back over to tell me she cut the pet fee in half to $50 (I consider that at the high end of "reasonable"). Now, the parking -- you're only hotel option is valet at $29/night. You can try to find a spot on the street (yeah, right! It's in the middle of downtown!) or you can go across the street to a parking garage (not sure of the rate). We went with valet for our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - great breakfast - great value; but no pool (if that's an issue).”
Reviews.Author: CNSmith
Reviews.Content: This was an improptu trip to B'More so our kids could visit the Science Center and National Aquarium. Property was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Despite a large breakfast crowd, the staff was efficient. Walking distance to Inner Harbor and all that goes along with that. There is no pool at this property; but they do have a bar/restaurant; kitchen closes at 10. (Note: The Hampton Inn and Suites is right aroud the corner; they have a pool but no lounge, suites are $30 more than Residence, parking is the same.) Only detractor was panhandlers around the property, but I live in a SMALL town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Inner Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: surreyuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel, like the SpringHill Suite next to it, have a great location to the Inner Harbor. A short walk will get you to all the Inner Harbor has to offer. The breakfast is good -- the hot breakfast you have grown accustomed to in a Residence Inn. TIP: The hotel staff will tell you that their parking is as expensive as you will find elsewhere -- and this is not true at all. If you are spending the weekend, you can go down the street and park in the parking garage and pay only $10 per day ... saving yourself $20. You don't get in/out privileges in the garage, but it works if you are just staying overnight and walking to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleepyjuli
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Our room was large, with a full kitchen. Beds were comfortable. The free breakfast is great and they also have an evening reception Mondays- Thursdays with free snacks and drinks. The hotel offers free high speed internet but not WIFI, which was a little disappointing. Parking is a little expensive. The location is great though. Two or so blocks from the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: hmmsbrown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times for business and have always had a terrific stay. This time was no exception. The staff was friendly and attentive as usual. The rooms are spacious and clean, with high speed internet. A nice breakfast is included, and the on-site laundry room is a huge plus. Since my last stay, they have opened a new bar/restaurant in the hotel, but I did not have a chance to check it out yet. I seemed to hear a lot less street noise in the room this time than during some previous stays. This may have been due to the room location, as well as the fact that some nearby construction (that woke me up during previous stays) seems to have been finished. Still wish they would expand their limited cable channel line-up, and was disappointed that they are no longer offering the Baltimore Sun as one of the free morning newspapers. They switched to USA Today. I prefer to read a local newspaper when I travel- please bring back the Baltimore Sun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: putmeonabeach
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Residence Inn in Baltimore on November 4th. My family consisted of my husband and my two children who are 16 and 11. We were also traveling with another family that had 4 children and were staying at the same hotel. The front desk was very accommodating with putting us on the same floor as our friends. It was a very nice experience. The hotel was conveniently located to the Inner Harbor approximately 2 blocks away. We had a 2 bedroom suite. The room was clean and even ready when we showed up earlier than our designated check in time. It was valet service so we didn't have to worry about our car at all. No matter where you go in the city you are probably going to have to pay for parking at your hotel. They had a nice bar in the lobby that had a happy hour with free wings and salad. In the morning we had a nice hot breakfast (french toast, eggs, sauage, etc.) before tackling the Inner Harbor for another day. We only stayed one night but I would definitely go back again to the same hotel. We didn't have to get our car from the valet until 5 pm that day, so it was like getting two whole days of parking for one price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NJSHADOW24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August with 4 adults & 4 kids, 4,6,8,& 10. Great location because it is an easy walk to inner harbor. The down side was they had no pool & bar closed early. We wanted to bring a glass of wine up to room when kids went to sleep but it closed 8-9. We did get 2 rooms that had an outer door that closed from the hallway so we had great privacy. Rooms were very clean and breakfast was nice. The front desk was helpful when asked about restaurants & directions. We left our car parked the whole time & walked to Inner Harbor, Aquarium, Children's Museum, and even to Little Italy. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieDenver
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a cruise that left out of Baltimore. I stayed the night ahead at the Residence Inn Downtown/Inner Harbor. Check in was very smooth.
