A room key card is needed to use the elevator, so I appreciated that extra security measure. The room itself was very spacious and very clean. We had two double beds, a stiing area with a work station and the kitchenette. We decided to walk down to the Inner Harbor, and stopped at the front desk for directions. The staff at the desk at that time was not very helpful or forthcoming with information about the local area. She just pointed us in a direction and said it was that way. The harbor was about a two block walk from the hotel. We enjoyed a beautiful afternoon in the sun, then went to Phillips Seafood for dinner. The crab cakes were the best. The beds were very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was good with a decent variety of offerings. Upon checkout, the bellman hailed us a cab right away, so no delays.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, car was vandalized”
Reviews.Author: radavis20
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself gets 4/5 stars. Rooms are comfortable, clean and modern. Front desk staff were very helpful at check-in and throughout our stay. Walking distance to the inner harbor. The hotel allows pets for an additional fee. Breakfast is also included. Breakfast includes a variety of cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, and eggs, meat, biscuits/croissants - waffles on the weekend. While the food was decent, the staff setting out the food and cleaning up were extremely rude. We were berated for moving tables to accomodate our group because they were 'in her pathway' and a group of guests were very loudly commanded to move the line out the door, instead of lining up in the serving area. We opted to park in the garage across the street to save a few dollars on the valet parking fee. This was great until we returned to our car the first night and found our window smashed in and the kids' DVD player stolen. We filed a police report and a report with the parking garage, only to have our claim denied because it was a 'self park' location. The morning we checked out, we overheard another family requesting to have the police called because their car (valet parked) was also vandalized. While we would definitely stay at another Residence Inn again, I would have to recommend avoiding this area if you are planning to park your car. The garages are insecure and the crime rate is high.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Good Price”
Reviews.Author: EmEs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn over Labor Day week end, and although it was very busy, the hotel handled the traffic just fine. Opt for a room rather than a suite if you would like, as it is huge with a kitchenette, et al. It's a better value than the one bedroom, unless you have more than two people staying there. Breakfast is included and you are walking distance to shopping and the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend with reservations...”
Reviews.Author: slludw22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a two week training class at the Federal Bldg. It was close to the training site and easy enough to there or to the Inner Harbor or even Camden Yards. The room had a mini kitchen with table, chair, fridge and microwave which was very nice for a long stay. the complimentary breakfast was disappointing given all the glowing reviews. Same thing every day. Scrambled eggs (processed, not fresh), cold cereal, tasteless pancakes and some type of meat. The best thing on the breakfast was the make-it-yourself belgium waffle. Most importantly, I would not recommend this hotel for a single woman traveling alone. There are many homeless people hanging around outside the hotel at night. They have no on site parking lot, you must walk three blocks and I did not feel safe in the neighborhood at night. Parking is very expensive also.

Reviews.Title: “RESTFUL STAY and FREE BREAKFAST Recharged Weary Travelers”
Reviews.Author: GoWhere
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable rates with Holiday Rate Discounts. Large spacious room; Very Clean with updated Bathroom. WE didn't stay long enough to need the Kitchen Area but we like the convenience and flexibility that it offers. The COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST is THE BEST we've found. Lots of variety and options and everything was tasty. We plan to return to Baltimore and this hotel later this Fall.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ellenanne
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk to Inner Harbor, clean, spacious 2-bedroom suite comfortably slept our family of 5, good breakfast, helpful staff - my son left his stuffed animals behind and they sent them to us the next day. Some loud sirens and street noise till around midnight that only seemed to bother me. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this property for more than 3 weeks. We had a 2 bedroom suite- with a king bed in one room and 2 queen beds in the other room. Being a Platinum Elite member, I have seen an assortment of Marriott properties but this Residence Inn really shines up above many other properties. One of the main factors is the attitude of the staff. Everyone was wonderful!!! From the time we checked in, Tabitha was one of the most efficient front desk staff I have ever seen. Nothing was impossible or difficulty for her. What mattered to her was customer satisfaction and it showed! The location of the property ids great- yes- it is not facing the inner harbor – but so what?? It’s just 2 blocks away and a 5 minute stroll. Loads of restaurants nearby as well as a 7’ eleven and CVS pharmacy right next to it. Many of the restaurants do home delivery as well. The suite itself was spacious and free internet was a bonus. Valet parking was 29 dollars but thats what it is in all the downtown hotels. The valet staff were so nice too. Housekeeping was again very good. The hotel was running almost full occupancy everyday of our stay but nevertheless the staff managed it very well. The hot breakfast was ample and containers were being refilled rapidly. The evening meals served form Mondays to Thursdays was also very good. Another bonus was the free use of internet in the lobby along with free printing service. Excellent! Overall, this property shines out as one of the finest Residence Inn properties I have stayed in and I would definitely stay here were I to return again to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, almost perfect for long stays”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn for 22 days while attending a conference in the BCC and I must say that is extremely convenient for long stays. The fully equipped kitchenette and the large size of the rooms make it easy to feel at home. Plus the buffet breakfast and complimentary evening light meals (Monday to Thursdays) help you keep within your budget. Add to that the convenience of a fitness room and free wired internet in your room and you have almost the perfect picture. Why did I not give 5 stars? Just for minor details such as: bathrooms are a little on the smaller size (sink is separated) and I also felt that the thoroughness of the cleaning of housekeeping staff seemed to decline a bit towards the end of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “So So Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Boat3
Reviews.Content: We were on a college visit and only needed to stay for one night. We picked the RI because we have 3 teenagers and few places can accommodate a family of 5 without needing two rooms. We paid around $249. per night, which I think is a lot for a hotel of this kind. When we arrived at 10pm we realized that this hotel is really not at the Inner Harbor but a few blocks away. That was my fault, I should have realized that. This neighborhood did not feel safe to me and there were people hanging around outside the hotel and near the lobby late at night (not guests) All night long there was screaming, laughing, horns, sirens etc outside the hotel. Very noisy! Our room looked out onto a dirty parking lot and a dumpster from the building across the way. This hotel is pet friendly. I did not realize this until we got there and we saw dog treats in a jar on the counter. When I asked for a pet free room they told us that the hotel does not set aside rooms that are pet free because they have the $100 upcharge to clean the room if a pet has been there. Anyone who has allergies can tell you that there is no way for a hotel cleaning crew to remove dander etc from a room that has had an animal in it. We had no choice but to stay at that point and I will say, no one had an allergic reaction but that was sheer luck. There should be a few rooms set aside as pet free. Food- We stayed in 3 Residence Inn's in one week and this one had the best food. The breakfast was plentiful, clean, and hot. We really enjoyed it! Perfect for a family on the go in the morning. This room had one king and 2 queen beds. Many other RI's only have two beds, two baths and a pullout couch. I liked that we did not have to use a pullout. Room was pretty clean but a bit run down- not what I am used to from Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouz
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Residence Inn in Baltimore was pleasant. The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and roomy. The free hot and delicious breakfast was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: It happens every so often that the hotel I stayed at is nothing like what I expect. The Residence Inn Baltimore Downtown/ Inner Harbor fits that category. It does not look as nice as it does on the hotel website. I have been wanting to stay here for some time, after seeing it rank so high on Tripadvisor. But as usually the case, when you expect much, it is easy to disappoint. I was given a room on the 8th floor (of 15), but the view was of another building's roof. Other than that, I was satisfied with the room. It had a full kitchen and separate area for bathroom, a sofa, a cute dining table, in other words, very good value for money. Not to mention the rate of $170 included free breakfast, a nice variety of good food. I was on a two-night day and everything was OK until the afternoon of my 2nd day when a bunch of rowdy students checked in on my floor. When I called front desk to ask for a room change, they told me, "they're just students," but front desk quickly found another room for me, away from the students, in fact, it was a suite with a much better view. I actually was beginning to like my original room and if the hotel did not put those students on my floor, I would be staying in that room for the remainder of my stay, instead of having to move to another room 12 hours before checking out. The next morning I went down to breakfast only to find the whole restaurant occupied by students, so I just took a cup of juice back to my room. I realize I may have picked the wrong time to stay at this hotel. I did not realize the Residence Inn caters to the student market over the weekend. Also, the aircon/heat in each room makes a strange noise. I would like to take away the positives of this stay. It's a block from Inner Harbor. When I arrived at the hotel, the doorman was quick to take my suitcase from the trunk of the taxi and leave it at the front desk. You can get complimentary Internet for a month. There is a 24-hour 7-Eleven right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “great location--close to everything”
Reviews.Author: lisacmaryland
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here. Great location; in walking distance of many Inner Harbor destinations. The hotel itself is clean and well kept. The free breakfast buffet was appreciated and the food good. The staff was helpful and prompt. The only problem we had was noise outside the hotel late at night. There was a loud fight in an alley running behind the hotel at 1 am which then resulted in gunfire. The noise didn't subside until 2 am. On a Saturday night you will hear a lot of police / ambulance noise around the hotel. Obviously this isn't something the hotel can control. During the day we didn't have any problems walking around the sidewalks in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location.”
Reviews.Author: SMCChick
Reviews.Content: We spent 11/14-11/16 at the Marriot for the ND/Navy game. The hotel was a five-min./2 block walk from the Inner Harbor and a 10-15 min. walk to M & T Stadium and Camden Yards. The police presence on every street, as well as the ND fans and Naval cadets, made us feel very safe, but we were always back at the hotel by 8:00 p.m. Dunkin' Donuts is nextdoor and CVS is one short block away. The complimentary breakfast was good, the free internet was also nice, and the very large room was perfect for us, a family of four with two teenage boys. We were on the 15th floor and heard a lot of sirens, but the noise did not prevent us from getting to sleep. The people at the front desk, especially Scarlett, were extremely helpful and friendly when recommending things to do and giving us directions. Hint: Give the valet 20-30 min. to get your vehicle. David, our valet, was especially nice. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who needs a clean, friendly, reasonably-priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the great”
Reviews.Author: WorkHardPlayHard2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a suite with my friends on Saturday night. Good: Everything was clean in the room. The little kitchen looked good even we didn't cook. Breakfast was A+, a lot of choices and great services. Not Good: Location was not the best. It is closed to downtown more than Inner Harbor. If you are traveler, you should stay really close to Inner Harbor or Harbor Place. Not downtown. I don't like that there are homeless across the hotel and they came to us for money or coffee. I didn't feel safe. I could hear sound from next room. Maybe people were partying.. It was so loud.. Overall, it's not too bad to stay but it's really not the best choice if we want to have walking distance to Harbor Place or Inner Harbor. I should have done more research and booked another hotel at better location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff. Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RougeWarrior
Reviews.Content: Very clean even though they allow pets. Very close to the harbor for those that prefer to have everything within walking distance. Slight mix-up with the reservation as I thought I had booked a 1 BR suite but was led to a King suite. However, they immediately took care of my family and our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MSDEE1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Residence Inn Inner Harbor on a weekend night (Sep 13) for a baseball game (Twins v. Orioles). Reserved room through hotel website and requested early check-in (Silver Elite members). Check-in was effortless and very smooth. We even got to check-in early. The front lobby is well-lit. The business center has about 5 computers that are available for use and a TV center with fireplace. Front desk personnel, Tabitha, was very friendly and made us feel welcomed. Upon check-in, I asked if we could get a higher # room. Instead, we got a free upgrade to a one-room suite (Rm 512). Living room w/pull out sofa and TV. Loved it! The room was clean and spotless. Kitchen is equipped with full-size refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, pots and pans, cabinets, table and chairs. Took service elevator because the hotel was experiencing technical difficulties with the second elevator in the lobby (left side). We were informed about this by Tabitha. Also, a letter to all guests explaining the situation was printed and readily available at the front desk. Received phone call from front desk (about 20 minutes after check-in) inquiring if everything was going well with the room. Complimentary breakfast was fine and replacement items came out quickly. However, very busy around 8:30a. There are 2 waffle machines, but a guest didn't oil the pan and burned the waffle maker. The food service employee had to disconnect the waffle maker to clean it which took about 10 - 15 minutes. Overall, all staff that we met while riding on the elevators, housekeeping, front desk personnel, the engineer, and manager/assistant manager are well trained and friendly. Valet parking is $28, but we self parked across the street overnight for $8. Camden Yards is about a 15-minute walk. Inner Harbor is 5-minute walk. There is a CVS Pharmacy and Dunkin Donuts adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: kimnjay
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and we were told our room wasn't ready. The staff was very professional and helped us in everyway. We had 7 in our party and 2 small kids. They immediately found something for our children to eat/drink and upgraded our room as well as discounted the rate. They made sure the rest of our stay was to our satisfaction. It didn't matter what time we visited the front desk someone took care of our every need with a smile. The valet attendants were amazing and helped with baggage, directions, as well as rescuing me and my son from some of the homeless on the street as we were walking back from inner harbor. The hotel is very convenient to inner harbor & most of the Baltimore attractions. I will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: denany
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at Residence Inn Baltimore. We have 3 young children, so we stay at Residence Inns probably at least 3 X a year. We were booked for a 1 bedroom suite but were offered 2 bedroom for $80 a night more so we decided to take it. Great layout with each bedroom (with en suite bath) being split of the main living area. Kitchen was fully stocked. Everything was spotless and nicely furnished. The staff was very friendly and breakfast was quite good with lots of choices. It was full but not packed or overrun. The location is very central, just a couple of blocks from the harbor with Dunkin Donuts, CVS, & 7 Eleven a stone's throw away. I had never been to Baltimore before and was surprised at what seemed to be a high number of homeless on a per capita basis. The homeless folks are the only thing that would give me pause, none of whom were scary (please note I've lived in the NYC for about 15 years). We would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Pens4821
Reviews.Content: Made a surprise trip to Baltimore for a night, and chose the Residence Inn. We've stayed at the Hyatt before and wanted to stay there again, but since we made the reservations about a week before check in this was much cheaper. The valet guys were extremely nice/helpful. We don't like using valet (Hyatt has a self parking option), but he explained that while it would be cheaper to park somewhere ourselves for the night, we would have to pay more for the next day and we had the valet until 5. We had business in the morning and figured this would be the best route. Another guy also told us how to get to where we needed to go the next morning. Check in was fast and easy. Once again very nice front desk. The employees at the desk were very nice everytime we came in/out. Also notified us of the free breakfast, but didn't have time to even look and see what they offered, but it's a nice extra. The rooms were great. Plenty of room and had a couch (sofabed) and chair. We were only there for a night, but the refridgerator and microwave would come in handy if you were going to be there a few days. While I like the comfort of the rooms at the Hyatt better, the amentities inside the rooms were better here- as mentioned fridge/microwave, as well as stove top and stocked drawers. Also had a full size coffee pot which was great. Location was great. Only a few blocks away from the inner harbor, and pretty close to Camden Yards. Once again, sorry to mention the Hyatt, but we like it's closer location to both better. While we have our favorite hotel in Baltimore, this really made a good impression on us. This has become our second choice now when visiting Baltimore. I'd recommend it to anyone who's going to be in Baltimore for a few+ days so you can better use the amentities in the room. Not too often can you bring leftovers from dinner to a hotel room downtown and be able to store them and heat them up later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: superwifeNJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after spur of the moment deciding to go to Baltimore and reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We checked in early, and because our room wasn't ready, they upgraded us to a top floor, three room suite with three beds and two bathrooms. Free breakfast, which is always a plus, and although parking is expensive, the hotel's location was conveinent enough so that we didn't need to use our car at all and were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: DivingD56
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here visiting Baltimore to go to 4 baseball games between the Orioles and the Boston Red Sox. My good friend and I arrived around 10:00 AM and our room was ready. It was one big well appointed clean room, with a kitchen area, a living room area,and 2 comfortable queen sized beds. The bathroom sink and vanity were outside of the bathroom which is handy. Though we never cooked, having a full sized coffee maker, a refrigerator and microwave do come in handy. They told us when we checked in that we did not have a view of the inner harbor and you can see that most of the rooms probably don't. It did not surprise us as we were in the cheapest category. The hotel was in a great location. We were a short walk to the Inner Harbor and all the wonderful things to see, eat and do there, yet within a ten minute walk to Camden Yards. Though we were two women we felt extremely safe even walking at night after games. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good, very crowded on weekends (or at least this one) but not an issue on Monday and Tuesday mornings. I was courteously also given a 1:00 late check out on Tuesday as my flight was not until 6:00. They held my luggage for a short time after until we had to leave for the airport. I would definitely stay here anytime I visit Baltimore and would not hesitate in anyway to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms with EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: lornem
Reviews.Content: We dont usually stay downtown but this was quite a surprise! Loved the huge rooms with everything included that you could imagine. Wireless internet access was easy to use. Bed was very comfortable. Separate living area and kitchen and bedroom was very large. Breakfast buffet had everything you could imagine. Staf was very helpful and courteous. Within walking distance of Convention center and the inner harbor! The Dunkin Donuts walkup window next door was VERY inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelcat10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were large and clean. The price was reasonable, considering the location. Hotel staff were very friendly. The location was excellent, being just a few blocks walk from the Inner Harbour. Our only concern was that it was quite noisy, despite being on the 12th floor. We could hear sirens throughout the night! But I guess that is part of being so central.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: NJ07054
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here 2 nights on the weekend. From the moment we checked in, I knew we had made a good choice as we were required to initial their no-partying and no-smoking policies. With 2 & 5 yr olds, quiet and fresh air are of utmost importance. The customer service people at the front desk were helpful and informative, giving us a great dinner recommendation to Mo's Seafood Factory on Albemarle. The rooms are a comfortable size for a family of 4. We had 2 queens which was just right. The room was clean and there was no hint of the smell of smoke in the linens as I have experienced at other hotels, even in non-smoking rooms. My only complaint about the room is that the beds were a bit firm for me, but I recognize that this is a personal preference. The bathroom was clean and of comfortable size, but not oversized. The kitchenette was also a big plus as we brought lots of food with us to satisfy the kids. The complimentary buffet breakfast was more than adequate providing a myriad of options including hot and cold selections. The valet service was friendly and efficient. I don't know what our other parking options were, but they took care of everything. A pool would have been nice, but we knew that there was none here when we booked it. There are lots of other hotels in the Inner Harbor area with pools, so if this is a primary concern, look elsewhere. Overall, a very positive stay in the Inner Harbor. I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: MUMom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while in town for a teacher's convention at the Baltimore Convention Center. Really nice for the money- although parking is pricey, so be aware. (but you probably can't find overnight parking nearby for much less....) The room was spotless, and the staff was friendly. My daughter decided to stay with us at the last minute, and the hotel was nice about sending up sheets for the sofa bed in the room, although they didn't offer to make it up. I didn't mind since we hadn't told them ahead, and they didn't charge us extra. You're about a block and a half from the convention center, about 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. Nice location for a city walk- Federal Hill close by, and the water taxi connects to Fells Point and Fort McHenry. The area was decent- I probably wouldn't have roamed at night by myself, but that's pretty much in any city. The hot breakfast buffet was especially nice- very fresh fruit, hot coffee, and a full breakfast menu including yogurt, oatmeal and pancakes, eggs and sausages, and potatoes. It would be a really nice spot for a family who wants to investigate Baltimore- the room was a King with a sofa bed, and had a kitchen. Lots of room to spread out. all in all, a very good value for the money we spent. We got the best price about 2 months out on the marriot Website.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jamacianbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn for two nights. After doing a lot of research on hotels in the inner harbor we decided to choose Residence Inn. We chose this property for several reasons. One of the reasons was price, although not inexpensive, it was under $200 and within walking distance to the inner harbor. Another reason we chose Residents Inn is due to the great reviews on this site. I have to say that this hotel lived up to all its great reviews. We had a basic room that was extremely clean and beautifully decorated. It came complete with full refrigerator, stovetop, microwave and dishwasher. Each appliance was spotless and new looking. What really impressed me was the shower. The tile in the shower was spotless. The bathroom was of average size with a basic tub/shower combination and toilet. The sink and vanity was separate from the bathroom. That is a really nice convenience. What we really liked was the complimentary breakfast AND dinner. The breakfast was complete with waffles, pancakes, scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, doughnuts, yogurt, nuts, and all kinds of cereals and condiments. It was never crowded when we ate. There was juice and a soda fountain for soda if you didn't want juice or coffee. In the evening they have an "evening reception" complete with a keg of beer. I was very surprised at seeing a keg of beer in the hearth room. I had not ever seen that before. I will say that this room was monitored by hotel employees at all times. It was very well organized and monitored. There was always some one wiping a table or refilling items that needed attention. One of the evenings I was there they had several pasta dishes and a salad bar. Extremely nice touch for those who do not want to leave the hotel for dinner. This hotel is only two blocks from the inner harbor. Very easy to walk there and lots of restaurants and shops along the way. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Residence Inn/Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mikesmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 15 days at the Residence Inn Inner Harbor . My husband had major surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital and it was a very stressful time for us. I had advised the front desk ahead of time that my husband was ill and they were so kind and accommodating to us. I called from the airport to ask them if they could have a wheelchair available and was told it was already waiting for us. Once my husband was hospitalized, there were many mornings when I had to be at the hospital by 5:30 a.m. I would ask them the night before to get me a cab and it was always waiting for me in the morning. Since my brother-in-law was with us to help me, we had a two bedroom/two bath corner unit. It was very nice. Always clean and very comfortable. The location was about two blocks from the Inner Harbor and next door to a CVS (which was great for me). Since we were not on vacation and I spent most days at Johns Hopkins, we didn't really explore the area or eat in any restaurants. Thankfully, my room had a full kitchen and this turned out to be very helpful. Breakfast every morning was more than adequate and the Monday - Thursday evening reception was a nice touch. Everyone at the Residence Inn/Inner Harbor helped to make a difficult situation much better. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: subdave
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn on Light Street is in a perfect location in the Inner Harbor. Only a couple of blocks from the convention center and a couple of blocks from the water's edge, Little Italy, etc. They have an ample free breakfast, cozy rooms, and sumptuous bedding. Shower and tv were above average and the ironing facilities made me feel at home, you know, too CHEAP to go to a dry cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service; Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KR1226
Reviews.Content: My review is of my stay from December 30, 2006 to January 7th 2007. The service of this hotel was great during our stay. They were all so very friendly, from the front desk, to the housekeepers, to the valet drivers. All were extremely helpful and pleasant to be around. The front desk staff were very helpful from the reservation making, to accommodating all of our special requests, and to check out time. Service wise, this hotel is definitely a 5 stars, hands down. Pros: Great service, really nice (extremely) spacious rooms, full kitchens (stove top, full size refrigerator, dishwasher, cabinet spaces (with pots/pans, plates, glasses, silverware, etc), sink vanity area separate from the shower/toilet area (which is a plus when more than one person is with you), complimentary breakfast, and a little gift shop if you've forgotten anything back at home or need a snack/drink. Cons: We found a fake nail in one of the folded towels and some of our pots and pans were dirty before we even used them. (This is the reason I dropped from rating this hotel 5 stars to 4 stars.) I also left a comment card for the management to read, however they never called or responded to it. Hence one of the reasons why I'm writing this review. Just some friendly advice to travelers debating on this hotel and hotels in the area, every 30 minutes or so there is an ambulance/fire engine/police car driving by with their sirens on day and night. I was on the 14th floor and it still was a nuisance at times. So if you're a light sleeper, you may want to consider bringing some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mj250
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for extended stay. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Enjoyed very much the afternoon cocktails. Only con: no on-site parking. Fine if you are traveling by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nununy
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. The parking valets and front desk staff were helpful and lovely. The hotel is new and nicely decorated. The room was great. Large comfortable bedroom, living room, kitchen, bathroom. Very clean. There is a fantastic breakfast with all sorts of hot and cold selections.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DebberWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because it was cheaper than staying directly on the inner harbor. This hotel is about 1-2 blocks from the harbor and we walked it every day (sometimes 2-3 times per day) - very easy walk! The service was impeccable and the room was gorgeous! It was very very spacious - the best room we have ever had and it was under $200 per night. We felt very safe walking back and forth from the harbor to the hotel at night. Maid service was wonderful with a clean and sparkling room every day. Beds were super comfortable and the kitchen area and living room area were very spacious! We will definitely stay here again if we visit Baltimore's Inner Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: TorontoToo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading favourable reviews on TripAdvisor and were were not disappointed. The hotel's website photos do a good job of representing what you can expect here. What we liked: -Service was exceptional, front desk staff (especially Scarlett) were always happy to answer a question or to offer assistance. From remembering our names to arranging transportation, offering dining and shopping recommendations to assisting with packages, the staff were always available to exceed our expectations. - Hotel is fairly new in comparison to most properties in this area. -Rooms were a good size and the fully equipped, spotless kitchen was much appreciated. -Air Conditioning worked perfectly. -Bed was extremely comfortable. -Room/bathroom very clean. -Proximity to Harbour was excellent - 5 minute walk to (small)malls, restaurants and entertainment. -Quiet room. -Breakfast and Manager's reception were very good and well organized. Food could be taken back to rooms. -Elevators worked efficiently, no long waits. -ATM in lobby, pharmacy and coffee shop next door. What disappointed us: -proximity to large shopping malls - if you don't have a car, count on a $30 taxi ride each way -Marriott Rewards preferences not acknowledged, no extra towels etc. (though we did confirm they had info on file and mentioned this) . . . not a major issue but worth noting - Car service (hotel recommended) to take us to airport did not show up, luckily bellman was able to find a taxi (after a tense 15 minute wait) I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if we return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: dlostyle77
Reviews.Content: First, let me preface this by saying that I stayed here two nights for free with credit card rewards, and we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite (which was almost as big as our house!) for free. The room was spotless, and had a full kitchen. It was broken up into 3 separate areas, separated by doors: 2 bedrooms at either end, and a living room with kitchen and office area in the center. A "welcome basket" which consisted of coffee and popcorn, as well as a Pepperidge Farm cookie packet, were in the room when we arrived. A glass jar filled with hard candy was also provided. The staff was helpful and friendly, the buffet breakfast was good (make your own waffle included), and the hotel is secure. Don't use your car, as everything worth seeing is within walking distance. I would NOT recommend walking into Little Italy (as we did) with children. It's a little shady, and a stroller is tough to maneuver over the uneven sidewalks. Stay along the water and just tour Fells Point. Only the adventurous should try the Lexington Market (as we did, to get crab cakes from Faidley's). It's a bit of a hike, and not in an inviting area. I wouldn't recommend the parking lot that the hotel uses, as I paid $21 per day to park there. Try one of the other lots, I think there are some that are at least $3 less per day.

Reviews.Title: “Fair priced for its location; breakfast pales compared to other Residence Inns”
Reviews.Author: charliebrownsnoopy
Reviews.Content: Good location (5 mins to harbour); room seemed new and very comfortable. Breakfast selection is average...closer to a Hampton Inn & Suites than the full breakfast buffet i've seen at a different Residence Inn Valet parking is pretty pricey ($28)...that's the price to pay for this location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: alteredcookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days in order to take my 3 year old daughter to the Baltimore Aquarium. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and it a location not too far from the harbor. We walked to the aquarium and it took us about 12 - 15 minutes. We had a two bedroom suite on the 14th floor and the room was immaculate. This hotel was only built 1 1/2 years ago, so the condition was great and the staff seems to do a nice job of keeping everything looking new. The included continental breakfast was much more than I expected. There was quite a bit of variety including some hot items. Considering this is a limited service hotel, I was surprised how good this was. They also have a happy hour in the evenings with free food and drinks, but we were never able to get back to the hotel in time to try this. Definitely a hotel I would recommend to anyone staying in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kellzz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had planned a weekend trip 2 weeks before the actual date. We were only able to book one night at the Residence Inn because of the convention that was going on. First off I would like to say that I am very anal about the hotel cleanliness and let me tell you, this place was spic and span!! The beds were so comfortable, living area was spacious, the kitchen was equipped with a large refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, stove!!! The free continental breakfast was great!!!! We ended up spending our second night over at the Marriot waterfront hotel which i was looking very forward to but turned out not so wonderful..wish we could have stayed our second night at the residence inn!! staff is very friendly too!!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Policy Problem”
Reviews.Author: flashover5
Reviews.Content: This high rise hotel is on a main drag about 2 blocks from Camden Yards and I 1/2 blocks from Baltimore's fabulous inner harbor.Upon arrival I was pleased that my request made the day before for a room on an upper floor was honored but was surprised to see a sign at the front desk saying that the hotel welcomes your pet.When I inquired about where exactly the pets stayed and whether a dog or cat could have been sleeping in the same bed I would be sleeping in, the 3 people behind the desk all assumed that "deer in the headlights" look until one of them finally made up what he probably thought was a good explanation: "we bomb (insecticide)the rooms after the animal leaves." This is ,of course ,ridiculous and even though he pointed out that the sheets are changed and the room cleaned , the curtains ,carpet ,bedspread and couch are not changed and the possibility of fleas ,hair and and pet dander left behind is a real sanitary issue.The fact that our bathroom had a long black hair on the white-tiled shower walls and the inside of the bathroom door had black fingerprint marks on it just emphasized that housekeeping is not the answer to residual pet issues.We also had the displeasure of seeing a guest come out of the hotel with his full size dog who promptly did his business on the grassy median section of sidewalk.The owner did not clean up. So If you and your pet are looking for an ok hotel in a great location then stay here. If ,on the other hand, you want and expect a higher sanitary standard then choose another area hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but noisy renovations”
Reviews.Author: alexandria
Reviews.Content: The bellhop, front desk staff, custodians were all extremely pleasant and helpful. The location is also excellent; walking distance to Inner Harbor attractions with very safe location for walking at night. The view of the Inner Harbor is beautiful at night. If you want to save some money on parking, park in Pier V garage rather than hotel parking lot. It is less than half the cost and very convenient. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. Extremely pleasant stay. This 4 star met and even exceeded my expections.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SunshineOnMeNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn. The rooms were clean, spacious, and new. The beds were comfortable and the kitchen well equipped. It was only a 5-10 minute walk to the inner harbor. The staff was friendly and courteous. The free hot breakfast each morning was a big plus. It was much more than we expected. I recommend the comdey factory which is a stand up comedy show just across the street above Burke's cafe. Hint: Do not sit in the front unless you are okay with being part of the show. Also if your looking for night life fun check out the powerplant live near the iner harbor on Market Place. They have multiple bars and sources of entertainment all in a central area. Howl at the Moon was a nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: cpete
Reviews.Content: I had read all the recent reviews on tripadvisor (my hotel bible). I found it more mixed than I had hoped. Pluses: Good size, quiet two-room suite. It was reasonably priced with excellent valet car service. There was a good kitchenette as a bonus. The top floor gave no problems with noise. Minuses: I had asked a crib be put in the room twice before we came. When I had to call from the room and ask the third time, the front desk said "Oh, would you like a crib in the suite?". Then I felt like a tip was expected for the 30 seconds it took to assemble. (I generally tip well, but didn't like that I had to ask 3 times). There was only one temperature control which would have been fine if I had known. The living room and the bedroom were somewhat different and I got up in the middle of night searching for an extra blanket. The linnens and pillows were disappointing too...5 pillows, but all the same - quite uncomfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn by Marriott Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Light St, Baltimore, MD 21202
